How having cumin water first thing in the morning can prevent heart disease
description: The main risk factor for heart disease development is hypertension, which doctors call high blood pressure. The natural vasodilator compounds in cumin, expand blood vessels to decrease vascular resistance which results in lower blood pressure levels. The potassium content in cumin helps regulate sodium levels, while causing blood vessel muscle relaxation which helps maintain normal blood pressure

title: Pills, pregnancy and politics: Trump links Tylenol to autism: what is it?
description: Donald Trump has ignited controversy by advising pregnant individuals to avoid Tylenol, citing a potential link to autism despite lacking scientific consensus. Medical experts swiftly condemned his remarks, emphasizing the safety of acetaminophen during pregnancy and the importance of vaccines. Conflicting studies on acetaminophen and autism highlight the need for further research, with health professionals urging consultation before making changes.

title: Kidney health and potassium: Why too much or too little can be risky
description: Potassium is vital for health, but it poses risks when kidneys fail. Kidneys filter excess potassium, but kidney disease impairs this function. High potassium is common in chronic kidney disease. It can cause muscle weakness and heart issues. Low potassium also harms kidney patients. Managing potassium in kidney disease requires balance.

Pro-Palestinian strikes, blockades across Italy
description: Across Italy, pro-Palestinian demonstrations, strikes, and blockades erupted in response to union calls denouncing the "genocide in Gaza" and demanding sanctions against Israel. These mobilisations coincided with growing international recognition of a Palestinian state, contrasting with Italy's cautious stance under Giorgia Meloni's government, which remains reluctant to recognise Palestine or impose trade sanctions on Israel amid the intensified Israeli military operation in Gaza.

title: H-1B visa hike: White House raises alarm; Says 40,000 US tech jobs lost to foreigners
description: President Trump introduced a $100,000 fee for H-1B visa applications, citing program abuse and American job losses. The White House claims companies are replacing American tech workers with lower-paid foreign labor, impacting national security. Trump aims to protect American workers by increasing costs for companies utilizing the H-1B program and prioritizing American-born workers in employment gains.
